citations.narrative:
The medical records for 50 dogs are incomplete. The physical exams for these dogs completed within the last 12 months
are not accounted for in the medical records. The Attending Veterinarian verified that all physical exams were completed
but not documented in the medical records for the dogs. Complete medical records allow the attending veterinarian, the
registrant and all animal caretakers to ensure that the medical needs of the dogs are accounted for and addressed. The
registrant must keep copies of medical records for dogs and make the records available for APHIS inspection. These
records must include the dates and findings/results of all screening, routine, or other required or recommended tests or
examinations. To be corrected by 8 April 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.13(b)(4) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The medical records for 50 dogs are incomplete. The physical exams for these dogs completed within the last 12 months 
are not accounted for in the medical records. The Attending Veterinarian verified that all physical exams were completed 
but not documented in the medical records for the dogs. Complete medical records allow the attending veterinarian, the 
registrant and all animal caretakers to ensure that the medical needs of the dogs are accounted for and addressed. The 
registrant must keep copies of medical records for dogs and make the records available for APHIS inspection. These 
records must include the dates and findings/results of all screening, routine, or other required or recommended tests or 
examinations. To be corrected by 8 April 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
